title: Saniya birthday proposal 4-page React flow with cute theme and animations

requirements.summary: Create 4 client-side routes (Page 1 → 2 → 3 → 4) that render correctly on direct navigation/refresh.
acceptanceCriteria: App has 4 distinct routes/pages (Page 1, Page 2, Page 3, Page 4).
Navigating directly to any page route loads that page without errors.
The primary intended flow is Page 1 → Page 2 → Page 3 → Page 4 via in-app navigation.

file_operations.description: Implement React Router configuration with 4 routes (Page 1–4) and ensure each route renders on refresh/direct navigation.
Create Page 1 route component and ensure it is reachable via the router.
Create Page 2 route component and ensure it is reachable via the router.
Create Page 3 route component and ensure it is reachable via the router.
Create Page 4 route component and ensure it is reachable via the router.

requirements.summary: Implement Page 1 landing page with Saniya’s name, the proposal question, and Yes/No buttons.
acceptanceCriteria: Page 1 prominently displays “Saniya” and the question text “Will you marry me?”.
Page 1 shows two interactive buttons labeled “Yes” and “No”.

file_operations.description: Add cute birthday-themed layout including “Saniya”, the exact question “Will you marry me?”, and two buttons labeled “Yes” and “No”.

requirements.summary: Add progressive “No” interaction on Page 1 with escalating/cycling messages on repeated clicks.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking “No” at least 5 times produces at least 5 distinct messages over time (cycle or escalate).
“No” never advances to the next page; only “Yes” advances the flow.
The interaction remains responsive and does not break layout at varying message lengths.

file_operations.description: Implement state-driven progressive “No” behavior (at least 5 distinct messages, cycling/escalating) that never triggers navigation and remains layout-safe for longer strings.

requirements.summary: On Page 1 “Yes”, play a visible celebration effect then auto-navigate to Page 2 after a short delay.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking “Yes” triggers a visible celebration animation.
After the animation starts, the app automatically navigates to Page 2 within ~0.5–2 seconds.

file_operations.description: Trigger celebration overlay/animation on “Yes” click, then navigate to Page 2 after a short delay (0.5–2s).
Create a reusable celebration effect component (confetti/hearts-style) suitable for Page 1 transitions.
Add required CSS keyframes/utilities for the celebration effect animation used by CelebrationOverlay.

requirements.summary: Implement Page 2 with the specified boyfriend compliment question and “Yes”/“Obviously” options.
acceptanceCriteria: Page 2 displays the specified question in polished, grammatical English while preserving the meaning.
Page 2 shows two buttons labeled exactly “Yes” and “Obviously”.

file_operations.description: Render Page 2 question in polished grammatical English preserving meaning, and show two buttons labeled exactly “Yes” and “Obviously”.

requirements.summary: On Page 2 selection, play a kiss effect then auto-navigate to Page 3 after a short delay.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking either button triggers a visible kiss/heart-style animation.
After the animation starts, the app automatically navigates to Page 3 within ~0.5–2 seconds.

file_operations.description: On either selection (“Yes” or “Obviously”), trigger a kiss/heart effect animation and auto-navigate to Page 3 after a short delay (0.5–2s).
Create a reusable kiss/heart-style effect component suitable for Page 2 transitions.
Add/extend CSS keyframes/utilities needed for the kiss/heart-style animation used by KissOverlay.

requirements.summary: Implement Page 3 birthday wishes message ending with the exact required final line.
acceptanceCriteria: Page 3 includes a birthday wish message addressed to Saniya.
The final line on Page 3 is exactly: “I love you so much, my ardhangani!”.

file_operations.description: Add a full birthday wish message addressed to Saniya and ensure the last line is exactly: “I love you so much, my ardhangani!”.

requirements.summary: Auto-navigate from Page 3 to Page 4 after a short delay without user action.
acceptanceCriteria: Page 3 transitions automatically to Page 4 within ~2–6 seconds.
Users can still refresh on Page 4 and see it render correctly.

file_operations.description: Add timer-based automatic navigation to Page 4 within ~2–6 seconds after Page 3 renders (no user action required).
Ensure Page 4 route is registered so refresh/direct navigation to Page 4 continues to render correctly.

requirements.summary: Implement Page 4 final emotional page with specified English text and an emotional emoji.
acceptanceCriteria: Page 4 displays the question “Do you really like this??”.
Page 4 displays the message “Never leave me” with an emotional emoji.
All user-facing text is in English.

file_operations.description: Render Page 4 with the exact question “Do you really like this??” and the message “Never leave me” followed by an emotional emoji, keeping all user-facing text in English.

requirements.summary: Apply cohesive baby pink & white romantic birthday theme across all pages with consistent typography/spacing/buttons and no blue/purple as primary palette.
acceptanceCriteria: All pages share consistent styling (background, typography, buttons) aligned to baby pink & white.
Primary UI elements do not use blue/purple as the primary palette.
Design remains readable and visually consistent across common screen sizes.

file_operations.description: Define global theme tokens (CSS variables) and base styles for baby pink & white palette, typography, spacing, and shared button styling; avoid blue/purple as primary.
Create a shared layout wrapper to enforce consistent page structure, spacing, and theming across all pages.
Wrap Page 1 content in the shared RomanticLayout to ensure consistent theme, spacing, and button styling across the app.
Wrap Page 2 content in the shared RomanticLayout to ensure consistent theme, spacing, and button styling across the app.
Wrap Page 3 content in the shared RomanticLayout to ensure consistent theme, spacing, and button styling across the app.
Wrap Page 4 content in the shared RomanticLayout to ensure consistent theme, spacing, and button styling across the app.

requirements.summary: Add required generated static images under frontend/public/assets/generated and render at least one in the UI (no backend image serving).
acceptanceCriteria: The app includes generated images located at frontend/public/assets/generated.
At least one generated image is visibly used in the UI (e.g., background/decoration).
No backend endpoints are used to fetch or serve these images.

file_operations.description: Add generated static image asset: frontend/public/assets/generated/bg-hearts-seamless.dim_1920x1080.png.
Add generated static image asset: frontend/public/assets/generated/cake-kawaii.dim_512x512.png.
Add generated static image asset: frontend/public/assets/generated/kiss-icon.dim_512x512.png.
Add generated static image asset: frontend/public/assets/generated/hearts-stickers.dim_512x512.png.

Render a decorative/generated background or inline decoration using frontend/public/assets/generated/bg-hearts-seamless.dim_1920x1080.png and optionally other generated stickers/icons to ensure at least one generated image is visibly used in the UI.

Display at least one generated decoration image (e.g., frontend/public/assets/generated/cake-kawaii.dim_512x512.png and/or frontend/public/assets/generated/hearts-stickers.dim_512x512.png) as part of the Page 1 UI.
Optionally reinforce the kiss effect/visuals by displaying frontend/public/assets/generated/kiss-icon.dim_512x512.png on Page 2 (static decoration), without any backend image serving.
